alert.note: Alert for Jackson (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 27 at 6:47PM MDT until June 27 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL JACKSON COUNTY... At 646 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Kadoka, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Jackson County, southeast of Kadoka. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota near Mile Marker 149. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris.
